body.p: The Kācikāṇṭam, "The book of Kāci", that is Kāśī (Benares), is a Tamil version of the Kāśīkhaṇḍa of the late version of the Sanskrit Skandapurāṇa. The Kācikāṇṭam is the work of the Teṉkāci ("Southern Kāśī") king Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, who ruled in the second half of the 16th century. See Raghavan (1960, p. 235). On Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, best known for his Naiṭatam, a Tamil version of the Sanskrit Naiṣadha by Harṣa, see Shulman (2012, pp. 155ff.).
Other manuscript testimonies of this text are: Bnf Indien 332‒333; GOML D. 565‒566 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 549ff.).
The palm-leaf bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U2: 250 folios, Tamil foliation 2‒249 (f1 unfoliated, as usual; 2 folios numbered 247) = text (mūlam), 8 lines per page.
Paratexts: marginal benedictions, marginal title, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statement, total kaṇṭams, total stanzas, text completion statement.

U2, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = incipit: benediction, title, chapter header in left margin; Kaṭavuḷ Vāḻttu, stanza n° 1 = Kāppu.
(f[1]r, lm, 1‒6) tirucciṟṟampalam kācikāṇṭam kaṭavuḷ vāḻttu
(f[1]r1) māṟṟariya tolpiṟavi maṟikaṭali ṉiṭaippaṭṭup ‡ pōṟṟuṟutaṉ kurai kaḻaṟṟāḷp puṇaippaṟṟik kiṭantōrai ‡
(f[1]r2) cāṟṟariya taṉimuṟṟit [i.e. taṉimuttit] taṭaṅkaraiyiṉ micaiyuykkuṅ ‡ kāṟṟeṟiyun taḻaiceviyak kaṭākkaḷiṟṟai vaṇaṅkuvām ‡‡
(f[1]r3) cīrpūtta ceḻuntaraṅkat tīmpuṉal mantākiṉittaṇ ṭēṉār koṉṟait ‡ tārpūtta ceñcaṭaiyi laṇintumata-
(f[1]r4) ṉ melviḻavu [i.e. mēlviḻaivu] taṇiyā ṉākik ‡ kārpūtta virumpivicumpiṟ kaṅkainati cūḻkiṭanta kāci vāḻu ‡ mēṟpūtta taṉi-
(f[1]r5) mutali ṉiṇaiyaṭip pūṅ kamalamal rettu [i.e. rēttu] vāmē – 1 – Alakil (...)

U3, folio 249, verso = excipit: Cēvikki Muṟamai (f242v, lm) [i.e. Cēviyattiṟam Uraittav Attiyāyam], stanza n° 69; total kāṇṭams and stanzas; text completion statement; total stanzas.
(f249v4) (...) – 68 – Arumaṟai muṉivar vāḻka vāṉiṉam vāḻkat teṇṇīr ‡ viritirai yulakatt(i)raṅku viṟalkeḻu vēntaṉ vāḻ-
(f249v4) ka ‡ maruviya tiṅkaṭōru maḻaivaḷañ curakkaveṅkōṉ ‡ poruvara moḻinta viṉṉūl poṟp poṭum poli kamātō – 69 –
(f249v6) Āka kāṇṭam ṉūṟukku tiruviruttam 2530 – kācikāṇṭamuṟṟum

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
